revised_title: The Evolution of Age and Election Trends in the Royal Society Fellowship
tldr: This article investigates the age and election trends of the Royal Society Fellowship between 1899 and 1943. It shows that the average age of elected fellows has been steadily increasing, and the mortality rates of older fellows have been heavier in the latter part of the period. The article also discusses the future size and age constitution of the Royal Society, forecasting different scenarios based on the number and ages of future successful candidates for the Fellowship.
